Formatting.Browser tabs: Use clear tab titles reflecting task or page. Prioritize user orientation.

Dates and time.Dates: Use readable formats and avoid ambiguity (e.g., Jan 1, 2025).
Dates and time.Time: Use 12h or 24h consistently. Include timezone when relevant.

Empty fields.Best practices: Use placeholder text sparingly. Labels must remain visible.
Empty fields.Content guidelines and examples: Provide sample inputs when helpful but avoid misleading examples.

Empty states.Golden rules: Use empty states to inform, guide, and encourage first actions.
Empty states.Guidelines: Provide actionable steps, avoid blame, and keep tone optimistic.

File details.File extensions: Display only when needed for clarity. Support recognition.
File details.User-uploaded files: Use clear error and success states. Support preview when possible.

Form fields.Name: Support diverse naming conventions. Avoid assumptions.
Form fields.Address: Format international-friendly fields. Avoid strict locale assumptions.
Form fields.Email: Use simple validation rules. Communicate errors clearly.

Links.Referring users to the Help Center: Explain why you're sending users there. Avoid dumping.

Numbers, units and currencies.Numbers: Use numerals for clarity in UI. Support grouping and decimals.
Numbers, units and currencies.Units of measurement: Use SI units and abbreviations clearly. Avoid mixing systems.
Numbers, units and currencies.Currencies: Show currency symbol and code where needed. Support localization.
Numbers, units and currencies.Phone numbers: Use international‑friendly formats. Allow flexible input.
Numbers, units and currencies.Credit card numbers and other PII: Mask sensitive data, show only necessary digits.

Text formatting.Bold vs. italics: Use bold sparingly to emphasize key points. Avoid italics in dense UI.
